messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] how can i find out if i have saurai in my history?
messages.msgSnippet: Jennifer- Since this is a history list, there is likely no one here who can assist your search. You ll need to check genealogical sites or perhaps the San
messages.messageBody:
Jennifer-
Since this is a "history" list, there is likely no one here who can
assist your search. You'll need to check genealogical sites or perhaps
the San Francisco Japanese-American History Archives. Now if you want
to learn more about what that heritage means check out;
www.samurai-archive.com/

-t

messages.subject: how can i find out if i have saurai in my history?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi! I m 25 % Japenese.  My mom was born at the foot of Mt. Fuji and lived there until she was 8. My grandmother was a fascinating women who stayed very true to
messages.messageBody:
Hi!
I'm 25 % Japenese. My mom was born at the foot of Mt. Fuji and
lived there until she was 8. My grandmother was a fascinating women
who stayed very true to her culture. Before she died, I remember
her talking of some kind of history of Samurai in her family. Is
there any way I can find out if it was true? It's not that I doubt
her honesty, it's just that she was sick in the end, and not as
sharp as before. Her Japenese name was Akiko Takeuchi. I think I
spelled that right. Any help would be appriecated!
